review_text: Susan's place is a safe and secure retreat for the weary traveler wanting to see some topography upon rising. Being from Chicago, we don't want to waste a minute when mountain views are on offer. Sitting in a wooden swing to watch the sunrise over the Smoky Mountains (or nestled inside with attractive views out every window) will remain a highlight of our journey through Appalachia. Perfect for a couple in search of quiet with all the modern amenities, this guesthouse with 1.5 baths was more luxury than we could have hoped for. We didn't stay long enough to use the kitchen, but I can imagine lighting that up with my own kit of staples, coffee/tea, spices, salt, sugar and condiments. It is immaculately clean with no evidence of any leftover groceries whatsoever. Laundry soap is provided for use in the top-quality washer/dryer set, and the pump soap on the bathroom vanity is also good for bathing. The decor is the perfect balance of personal charm and welcome-all. Nothing hotel-ish about it other than the brand-new feel of everything in the accommodation. The stage is set with hospitality in mind plus a welcome measure of share-economy cooperation (such as where to put the towels, etc, on check-out). Susan clearly wants you to enjoy the space, and we did. Instructions are clear and logical, not overbearing. Her response time is ideal for people on winding roads in the dark and rain. Our only regret was not getting to meet Susan, as her reviews suggest she's a good conversationist and an interesting host. As Airbnb hosts ourselves, we appreciate seeing what it feels like when done beautifully. And on top of it all, this was the first morning on our road trip to and from Florida that I awoke without a backache. Wonderful.
